clues.text: Much to his dismay, a silly rabbit realizes over & over again that this fruit-flavored cereal "is for kids"
Certainly some bunnies had a hare trigger after this country installed rabbit-proof fences in the early 1900s
At a mad tea party this participant chides Alice with, "It wasn't very civil of you to sit down without being invited"
This third book of the Bible says rabbits, due to "divideth not the hoof", are "unclean"; first off, how dare you!?
Lepus symbolizes a hare, likely angry as he's seen by some as the prey of these 2 Latin-named constellations, Orion's hounds
This Kentucky track known for its iconic twin-spired grandstand was designated a national historic landmark in 1986
Most of the equestrian events of the 1984 Summer Olympics were held at this 320-acre track in Arcadia, California
Anyone worth their "salt" should know the 12th Earl of Derby created the Oaks, a race run on this British track since 1779
The track at Saratoga Springs, New York offers this type of race where the horse jumps over obstacles
This Baltimore track was named for a tavern near London favored by early American colonists
If you read Lisa Scottoline's bestsellers, it makes sense she graduated from this school at Penn & has taught there
A short story by Wyalusing-born Philip Van Doren Stern was the basis for this beloved Jimmy Stewart holiday movie
This playwright's childhood home in the historically Black Hill District of Pittsburgh has become an arts center
His first 4 novels, including "Rabbit, Run", all depict a fictional version of Berks County, where he grew up
Before vast novelized histories of Hawaii & the Mideast, he put his Doylestown youth into "The Fires of Spring"

rounds.category: PUT SOME RESPECT ON MY NAME

clues.text: She won Amnesty International's Ambassador of Conscience Award & "Woman of the Year" in Sweden in 2019
In 2010 he became the first chef to receive Spain's Order of Arts & Letters Medallion
After reading "The Cosmic Connection", Isaac Asimov told him, "You are smarter than I am. I hate that"
Per Time magazine, "on the seventh day" he "cobbled together the World Wide Web's first (but not the last) browser"
Before she was appointed U.S. Attorney General, she received the Medal of Honor--from the Florida Bar Association
Adjective describing a first-person account of a life story
A nondisclosure agreement is also known as this kind
It's the practice of living on fruits, nuts & other plants, maybe some eggs & dairy, but definitely no meat
Marijuana advocates have long pushed for this removal of serious penalties; in 2024, the Biden administration moved to grant their wish
It's the branch of medicine concerned with the distribution & control of diseases
In 1758 Halifax, capital of this province, was the site of Canada's first representative government
Founded by Samuel de Champlain in 1608, this city has a name that comes from Algonquian for "the river narrows here"
This Alberta city is called "The Gateway to the North" & in the 2022-23 season, the gateway to 64 Connor McDavid goals
This Manitoba city is called "The Gateway to the West" & in the 2022-23 season, the gateway to 42 Mark Scheifele goals
It has been the capital of British Columbia ever since the province joined Canada in 1871
"Why do you lead me" on one of these ridiculous quests, an unhappy Sancho Panza asks Don Quixote
Buffalo Bill met the Queen of England "at the door of the box, with my sombrero in my hand and welcomed her to" this place
In a 1964 Caldecott Medal winner, young Max cries, "Let the wild" this "start!"
In the Old Testament an angel tells Hagar that she will bear a son who "will be a wild man" & that she should call him this
"None of nature's landscapes are ugly so long as they are wild", this environmentalist wrote in 1898
Latin for "before" gives us this poker word for the initial wager all players must make
It's the 4-letter bet where you get paid if your horse comes in 1st, 2nd or even 3rd
This type of parlay that combines multiple bets in one wager shares its name with an all-play-all tournament
Guess the color of Gatorade dumped on the coach's head to win this 4-letter kind of side bet
The Martingale betting system suggests: at least do this after every loss to recoup the initial stake
Let the "R" take a break from the energy required to move an object against a force & season this Asian pan
Remove an "R" from a word for a family member & get this word for annoy, which that person might do to you
Render the "R" from a type of cooking fat & meet this word for a young fellow
Ship off the "R" on the word for a boat's docking locale & get this first name of female characters Dutton & Harmon
Kick out the "R" from a pile of stones on a hiking trail & wander aimlessly; the word becomes this name of a man in Genesis
It seemed an unlikely goal, but Eliezer Ben-Yehuda made this biblical language spoken once more
Irish is one form of this language also called Erse
The ancient Middle Eastern region of Fars is the birthplace of this country's official language
Tamil is the official language of this Indian state with "Tamil" in its name
In 2011 Morocco made an official language of Tamazight, the native tongue of this large ethnic group
In the 1898 Fashoda Crisis, the British squared off with this country's Major Marchand over rights to the Sudanese Nile
A Japanese financial crisis was sparked in 1927 when a govt. minister mistakenly said that the Tokyo Watanabe one of these had gone bust
One crisis that jump-started the Intl. Crisis Group: famine in this land where clans fought after Mohammed Siad Barre's dictatorship
A crisis was sparked by this leader's 1958 demand that the U.S. & its allies pull their troops out of West Berlin
A 21st century humanitarian crisis was caused by the Islamist insurgency of this group also called the Nigerian Taliban
A short life story of someone, & a 3-member musical act
A trainee in a skilled trade, & to lure by arousing desire or hope
A tremulous, pulsating vocal effect, & a Russet Burbank
Disfiguring skin disease once resulting in quarantining, & a little too interested in the affairs of others
To pay no attention to, & an Italian version of "Mr." heard in "That's Amore"

rounds.text: Still around today, this strep infection that causes a rash has terrible effects in "Little Women" & the "Little House on the Prairie" books
